engine.main

Class ObjectController

  • java.lang.Object
    • engine.main.ObjectController

  • public class ObjectController
extends java.lang.Object

    Manages all GameObjects in the game.

    Holds all active game objects. Updates and renders each object each frame. Provides methods of getting game objects and filtering objects based on a String tag.

    Author:
    Taylor Houthoofd

    • Constructor Detail

        public ObjectController()
        Constructor. Sets up the object controller for use.

    • Method Detail

      • addObject

        public void addObject(GameObject obj)
        Adds a GameObject to the list of active game objects. Passes the controller to the object and adds to the list of objects to add.
        Parameters:
        obj - GameObject to add

      • removeObject

        public void removeObject(GameObject obj)
        Adds a given GameObject to the list of objects to remove.
        Parameters:
        obj - GameObject to remove

      • getGameObjects

        public GameObject[] getGameObjects()
        Gets an array of all GameObjects in the game
        Returns:
        Array of GameObjects

      • getGameObjects

        public GameObject[] getGameObjects(java.lang.String tagFilter)
        Gets an array of all GameObjects that contain a String tag
        Parameters:
        tagFilter - filter
        Returns:
        filtered GameObjects

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Removes all GameObjects from the game.

      • Update

        void Update()
        Calls the "startUpdate" function in all active GameObjects. After all objects are updated, removes all GameObjects queued to be removed, adds all GameObjects queued to be added.

      • Render

        void Render(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Calls the render method in all GameObjects. GameObjects called in layer order, with lowest layer called before higher layers.
        Parameters:
        g - Graphics object
